players.title: Players
players.errorMessageNotEnoughPlayers: The Players module needs two players to work.

inOrder.title: Order
inOrder.explanation: This option sets the order in which the next player is chosen. In the extreme cases, this is done in order or completely random. In between, the order's influence increases or decreases.

explanation.overview: Tags allow you to filter the questions based on content.
explanation.state-ignore: In this state the tag is ignored.
explanation.state-require: In this state only questions that have the tag are shown.
explanation.state-prohibit: In this state only questions that do not have the tag are shown.

deepness.title: Deepness
deepness.explanation: Each question has a "deepness". The bigger its deepness, the more personal the question.

order.title: Order
order.mainExplanation: If turned on, the questions will appear in a random order.

randomness.title: Randomness
randomness.explanation: In the extreme cases the questions get shuffled either within or regardless of deepness. In between, the deepness plays a bigger or smaller role depending on the exact position.

explanation.slogan: Getting people to talk about the stuff that really matters
explanation.rulesIntro: There is but one rule when playing deep:
explanation.rule1: Giving no or only a partial answer is always legitimate and doesn't require an explanation.
explanation.rulesExplanation: It is not about pressuring people to talk about their secrets. And some of the questions you will have no answer to, or an answer that you don't feel comfortable discussing (yet). That's fine, play on.
explanation.adviceIntro: However, besides the one rule, there are a few pieces of advice that make playing deep better:
explanation.advice1: deep has a lot of filters and settings. Before you start playing, quickly look through them and set them according to the players.
explanation.advice2: Ask back! Let everyone answer if they have something they want to talk about. Share all of your experiences and talk about the differences and similarities.
explanation.advice3: Don't know an answer to the question as it is, but to a similar question? Change the question! The questions should serve you, not the other way around.
explanation.advice4: Go off on a tangent! If you end up having a long meaningful conversation that started out with just one question, you have won the game. It's not about answering as many questions as possible, but about having good conversations.
explanation.advice5: And in general: Do with it whatever you want. If it helps you — great.
explanation.howToIntro: There are no rules of how the game actually works, do whatever you feel is helpful. If you would like to get some inspiration, try one of the following:
explanation.howTo1: Select the mode "Random Question" and pass the phone around to let everybody have their turn answering a question. Or use the "Players" module to let deep choose the next player for you!
explanation.howTo2: Select the mode "Choose From 3" or "Choose From 5" and let the player who just answered the question choose the question they would like to ask the next player. Alternatively, the person answering chooses which of the questions they would like to answer.
